articles.title: Who Is Kayla Sprinkles? Andrews High School Teacher Information
articles.description: A high school teacher in Cherokee County, North Carolina has been charged with engaging in sex acts with a student while employed by the Cherokee County Schools System.

articles.description: Mecklenburg County has joined a growing number of North Carolina jails that have ended in-person visits, a move that has drawn criticism because inmates can only talk to family members … Click to Continue »

articles.title: Suspected gunman in York Co. shootout taken to SC detention center
articles.description: The suspect accused of murdering a York County law enforcement officer and injuring three others in a deadly shooting has returned to South Carolina.

articles.author: By Camila Molina cmolina@newsobserver.com
articles.title: NC sheriff accused of calling Latinos 'taco-eaters' wants to work with ICE again
articles.description: Protesters gathered near the Alamance County Detention Center in Graham, North Carolina to oppose the return of the controversial 287 g program that allows state and local agencies to partner with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

articles.author: Jackie Salo
articles.title: Teacher fled when she saw student sex charges on social media: cops
articles.description: A North Carolina teacher reportedly fled town when she learned on social media that she was charged for having sex with a student, according to officials. Kayla Sprinkles, 26, was indicted by a grand jury on sexual assault charges June 4 after allegations sur…

articles.title: Man arrested on drug charges in Rowan County
articles.description: It also appears that the man violated his probation due to failure to pay fines and testing positive during a drug screening.

articles.author: By Ames Alexander aalexander@charlotteobserver.com
articles.title: Isolation left him 'forever torn up.' Critics urge Mecklenburg to end solitary confinement.
articles.description: A group of former inmates and clergy members gathered near the Mecklenburg County jail Thursday afternoon to speak out against the use of solitary confinement - and about the what they called the "barbaric" treatment of inmates.

articles.title: AG Sessions Helping Immigration Courts End ‘Catch-and-Release’
